thread.title: We Tried A Gender Neutral Online Personal Shopper
thread.title_full: We Tried A Gender Neutral Online Personal Shopper

author: Branson LB
title: We Tried A Gender Neutral Online Personal Shopper
text:
View this image ›
Via youtube.com ID: 10273356 It’s called Greyscale Goods , and it was started by Sara Medd, a queer woman living in Los Angeles. View this image ›
Via greyscalegoods.com ID: 10273361 2. As someone who personally struggles with binary clothing options, I decided to try it out. Video available at: https://youtube.com/watch?v=cqHjl6ORHJQ . youtube.com ID: 10273404 3. The first step was completing the style profile. View this image ›
ID: 10273408 4. The profile asked me about my measurements, what sizes I typically wear, and outfits I could see myself wearing. View this image ›
ID: 10273436 5. Like many online personal shopping services, Greyscale Goods sends you a box of clothes, (for a styling fee of $48) and you send back the clothes that you don’t want. View this image ›
ID: 10273501 6. Now for the bad news: There is currently a 8-12 week waiting list for those who fill out profiles now. View this image ›
ID: 10273663 7. Anyway, my clothes arrived! View this image ›
ID: 10273554 8. Using a few items from my own wardrobe, I put together three looks. View this image ›
ID: 10273561 9. The first outfit was something I never would’ve picked out on my own, but something I ultimately fell in love with. View this image ›
ID: 10273564 10. The second outfit was something a little more casual, that I could easily find in my existing wardrobe. View this image ›
ID: 10273570 11. Ultimately I decided I did not need another flannel. View this image ›
ID: 10273577 12. The final outfit was, by far, my favorite. View this image ›
ID: 10273579 13. One of my co-workers even told me that I looked like I belong in a punk band. View this image ›
ID: 10273584 14. My final thoughts? The clothes were a bit on the pricey side, so I would urge people to keep that in mind before trying the service. View this image ›
ID: 10274361 15. But overall, I was super satisfied with Greyscale Goods and pleased a service exists for people like myself who dress outside the binary. View this image ›
ID: 10273626 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
Branson LB is an LGBT video producer for BuzzFeed News and is based in New York. Contact Branson LB at branson.lb@buzzfeed.com .
